title: How to Make Cinnamon Maple Toast

steps.headline: Crack the eggs into the mixing bowl.
Pour in the milk and whisk into the eggs.
Add the brown sugar, spices and vanilla to the egg and milk mixture.
Heat the pan, skillet or griddle over a medium heat.
Dip a slice of bread in the spiced egg and milk mix.
steps.description: Cover the slice without making it soggy.

steps.headline: Add to the heated pan.
steps.description: Cook for 3 to 5 minutes each side, or until slightly golden.

steps.headline: Serve hot.
steps.description: Drizzle with maple syrup and a dab of butter on each cooked slice.

steps.headline: Crack the 2 eggs and pour the yolk into the small bowl.
Whip the eggs with one of the forks.
Grab one piece of bread and press it into the yolk.
steps.description: Let the bread suck up the juice.

steps.headline: Set the pan with the oil inside on the stove.
steps.description: Set the stove to medium or high.

steps.headline: Repeat with the other slice of bread.
Set the pieces of bread in the pan one at time or both in it but not touching.
Sprinkle cinnamon on the top of the slices.
steps.description: With a spatula, flip the bread and do the same to the other side.

steps.headline: When the bread is fully dark brown, turn off the stove and set the breads on a plate with the spatula.
Sprinkle a spoon of powdered sugar on both slices.
Sprinkle a little cinnamon on top of the sugar and put as much syrup as you wish.
Grab the last fork, your cup of milk, and enjoy!

text: Cinnamon maple toast Crack the eggs into the mixing bowl. Whisk them. Pour in the milk and whisk into the eggs.  Add the brown sugar, spices and vanilla to the egg and milk mixture. Whisk in until dissolved. Heat the pan, skillet or griddle over a medium heat. Spray with cooking oil. Dip a slice of bread in the spiced egg and milk mix. Cover the slice without making it soggy. Add to the heated pan. Cook for 3 to 5 minutes each side, or until slightly golden. Repeat for each slice.  Serve hot. Drizzle with maple syrup and a dab of butter on each cooked slice. Cinnamon toast with maple syrup Crack the 2 eggs and pour the yolk into the small bowl.  Whip the eggs with one of the forks.  Grab one piece of bread and press it into the yolk. Let the bread suck up the juice. Set the pan with the oil inside on the stove. Set the stove to medium or high. Repeat with the other slice of bread.  Set the pieces of bread in the pan one at time or both in it but not touching.  Sprinkle cinnamon on the top of the slices. With a spatula, flip the bread and do the same to the other side. When the bread is fully dark brown, turn off the stove and set the breads on a plate with the spatula.  Sprinkle a spoon of powdered sugar on both slices.  Sprinkle a little cinnamon on top of the sugar and put as much syrup as you wish.  Grab the last fork, your cup of milk, and enjoy!
